intro: Spiesia tibetica, commonly known as the Tibetan spurge, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and unique floral structures. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, adapting to the harsh conditions of its habitat. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in cyathia, a feature typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Spiesia tibetica is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
